headline.main: When GoFundMe Is the Safety Net

docs.abstract: Families and parents using GoFundMe for what should be small setbacks like car repairs and rent increases have been all over my social media of late.
docs.snippet: Families and parents using GoFundMe for what should be small setbacks like car repairs and rent increases have been all over my social media of late.

docs.lead_paragraph: William Ackman renewed his attack on Herbalife during a CNBC interview on Wednesday, likening the nutrition and weight management company to Bernard Madoff.

headline.sub: Bill Ackman: How Herbalife is like Bernie Madoff

docs.snippet: William Ackman renewed his attack on Herbalife during a CNBC interview on Wednesday, likening the nutrition and weight management company to Bernard Madoff.

docs.lead_paragraph: GERST--Jeffrey C.,of Tenafly, NJ, passed away on Monday, January 5th at age 54. Jeffrey was a superb student and athlete. He graduated from Phillips Academy, Andover, Massachusetts in 1976 winning the Math Prize, Physics Prize, German Prize and an Athletic Cup. His Physics Professor at Andover, Dr. Apgar, wrote of Jeffrey in his college applications that Jeffrey Gerst was perhaps "the best physics student he had ever had the pleasure of teaching, perhaps the best in the galaxy, if not the Universe." Jeffrey was admitted to all the Ivy League Schools to which he applied including Princeton, Yale, Columbia and Harvard. He was offered a coveted John Jay Scholarship to Columbia University, but chose to attend Harvard University instead as an Astrophysics Major. He eventually switched to Pre-Med as his father, Paul H. Gerst, MD, a Cardiothoracic Surgeon (Columbia C' 54, P & S '58) and Chief of Surgery at two hospitals in New York, and his grandfather, David Gerst, MD were both prominent New York physicians. Jeffrey's mother, Elizabeth C. Gerst, PhD, was an international award winning physiologist and co-author of "The Lung", 1957 (Yearbook Publishers), which was translated into 14 languages. She used her groundbreaking text to teach respiratory physiology at medical schools of the University of Pennsylvania, Cornell and Columbia University College of Physicians & Surgeons, were she retired as Assistant Dean of Post-Graduate Medical Education. Jeffrey's grandmother, Hilde W. Gerst, a renown New York and Palm Beach art dealer passed in 2006. Jeffrey is survived by his old brother Steven R. Gerst, MD, MBA, MPH, CHE, a healthcare management consultant and investment banker, Andrew L. Gerst, JD, LLM, a Washington, D.C. attorney, his niece Chantal E.D. Gerst, a Masters student in Nutrition and her husband, Elliot Otelsberg with TIAA-CREF. Jeffrey will be sorely missed. Jeffery will be buried along-side his parents at George Washington Memorial Park Paramus NJ on Friday, January 9 at 2:30pm. Services by Barrett Funeral Home Tenafly, NJ. 1/3

docs.lead_paragraph: Nourishing stock is popping up on restaurant menus and replacing caffeine in the cups of Americans on the run.

headline.seo: Bone Broth Evolves From Prehistoric Food to Paleo Drink

docs.abstract: Popularity of Paleo diet and emphasis on eating for health has given rise to restaurants offering stock or broth as part of meal or as beverage; recipe for beef bone broth offered.
docs.snippet: Nourishing stock is popping up on restaurant menus and replacing caffeine in the cups of Americans on the run.

docs.lead_paragraph: The DASH diet, rich in vegetables, whole grains and low-fat dairy, has been named the best overall diet for the fifth consecutive year, outpacing Weight Watchers and the Mediterranean diet, U.S. News & World Report said on Tuesday.

headline.main: DASH Named Best Overall Diet for Fifth Year: Report
headline.print_headline: DASH Named Best Overall Diet for Fifth Year: Report

docs.snippet: The DASH diet, rich in vegetables, whole grains and low-fat dairy, has been named the best overall diet for the fifth consecutive year, outpacing Weight Watchers and the Mediterranean diet, U.S. News & World Report said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Junk Food in the New Year

docs.abstract: People keep buying junk food once the holidays are over, a new study has found.
docs.snippet: People keep buying junk food once the holidays are over, a new study has found.

headline.main: Nestlé Health Science to Invest $65 Million in a Biotech Start-Up

docs.abstract: Nestlé Health Science is investing $65 million in Seres Health, a start-up focused on restoring the “microbiome,” the host of microorganisms that provide vital functions for humans.
docs.snippet: Nestlé Health Science is investing $65 million in Seres Health, a start-up focused on restoring the “microbiome,” the host of microorganisms that provide vital functions for humans.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans remain in charge of the House, but it won't be the same Republicans leading many committees.

headline.main: Same GOP Leadership; New House Committee Chairs
headline.print_headline: Same GOP Leadership; New House Committee Chairs

docs.snippet: Republicans remain in charge of the House, but it won't be the same Republicans leading many committees.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican senators poised to lead major committees when the GOP takes charge are intent on pushing back many of President Barack Obama's policies, setting up potential showdowns over environmental rules, financial regulations and national security.

headline.main: New Senate Chairmen Aim to Undo Obama's Policies
headline.print_headline: New Senate Chairmen Aim to Undo Obama's Policies

docs.snippet: Republican senators poised to lead major committees when the GOP takes charge are intent on pushing back many of President Barack Obama's policies, setting up potential showdowns over environmental rules, financial regulations and national security.
